intro: Senecio mitonis, commonly known as the silverleaf senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is known for its silvery-gray foliage, which is covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typical of the daisy family. Senecio mitonis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and low maintenance requirements.
